wikipedia_page.main: Glen Daly (born Bartholomew Francis McCann McGovern Dick c. 1920 – 1987) was a Scottish singer and entertainer.

link_mentions.page: Hail, Hail, the Gang's All Here
response: By the 1950s, the chorus of the song (with revised lyrics) had become popular in Irish and Scottish communities as being part of "The Celtic Song", sung by the fans of Glasgow Celtic in Scotland and later other teams. Glen Daly recorded an "official version" of "The Celtic Song" that is commonly played at Celtic Park prior to matches.

There are many versions of the song. However, the original version, played at Parkhead, was recorded by Glen Daly in 1961. To mark the 50th anniversary of the original release, Shane MacGowan recorded his version in 2011.
Glen Daly included the song on his album It's Glen Again - "Live" at the Ashfield, Glasgow (1970).
* Glen Daly on A Glasgow Night Out (1971)
